intro: Onopordum virens, commonly known as the green hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender stems and alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellowish-green, blooming in late summer, and it produces small, oval-shaped seeds that are dispersed by wind. Onopordum virens is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it is considered a common weed in agricultural areas.
